Should we fix the peg with an emergency vote to lower stablecoin LR and increase stablecoin DC? Governance       Yeah, appreciate the effort, but these aren’t acceptably worded poll options:  [image]  Make them credibly neutral. Your job is to find out whether people actually agree with you, not try to manipulate them into agreeing with you and getting the results you want. To be clear, this is fine to some extent in the attached text (though I would still much prefer you tried to present a balanced perspective). But not in the poll options, keep these bias free.  Follow the practical guide, read the emerg…

content.content: OK- its actually not meant to be that biased but i guess some people may see it that way

I chose no, but not for the reason in the poll option. I’m coming around to QE, but I think MKR could be a bad asset to buy because it is worthless if ES happens. 30M purchase of assets would also cause a lot of slippage, and would be vulnerable to front running.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: This would go against the entire premise of the protocol, and would be very prone to catastrophically backfiring. Every Dai must be backed by more than its value in collateral.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: Doesn’t qualify as a signal request. Please follow the practical guide. Changed tags and title to reflect this as an informal poll.

I think the plan in the ES case is that the protocol would be redeployed, and if it was a malicious shutdown, the attackers MKR would remain burned. Not saying that it wouldn’t decimate the MKR price, but I don’t think it would go to zero unless everyone gave up and made no effort to redeploy.
